definition: to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)

sentences.english: One springback compensation method for car stamping die surface is narrated.
sentences.chinese: 介紹了汽車衝壓模具型面反彈補償的一種方法。

sentences.english: Over-use can cause rebound nasal congestion.
sentences.chinese: 過度使用可能會導致反彈鼻塞。

sentences.english: In that case, the price spike would be something like a dead-cat bounce.
sentences.chinese: 在那種情況下，股價峯值可能會像死貓詐屍一樣反彈。

sentences.english: But Shenzhen Stock Cheng Zhi, because is implicated the bank tectonic plate is small, bounce dynamics is slightly big.
sentences.chinese: 而深證成指由於受銀行板塊拖累較小，反彈力度稍大。

sentences.english: S. demand for foreign goods will rebound with the economy.
sentences.chinese: 隨着經濟的復甦，美國對外國產品的需求也會反彈。

sentences.english: These materials will be re-crushed after rebounding into the scale board.
sentences.chinese: 這些材料將被重新成規模後板反彈粉碎。

sentences.english: The company can only go to hell in a handbasket with this damned dead-cat bounce.
sentences.chinese: 該死的死貓反彈只能使該企業的所處的境地迅疾惡化。

sentences.english: When the noise bounces off a fish or a rock, the dolphin hears the echo come back again.
sentences.chinese: 當聲音從魚或岩石反彈回來時，海豚再次聽到回聲。

sentences.english: They ricochet off the armor, leaving drops of glistening venom.
sentences.chinese: 射彈被盔甲反彈回去，盔甲上留下閃閃發光的毒液。

sentences.english: The singularity of big bounce model in the brane world is studied.
sentences.chinese: 研究膜上反彈模型的奇異性。

sentences.english: 'That, in and of itself, is an impressive rebound,' Mr. Colas says.
sentences.chinese: 卡羅斯說，這本身就是一個令人印象深刻印象的反彈。

sentences.english: An overhead shot hit very hard, usually before the ball has bounced.
sentences.chinese: 過頂大力擊球，通常是在球落地反彈之前。

sentences.english: Stock markets rallied as a form of relief from possible Armageddon.
sentences.chinese: 美國股市在避免了一場可能的末日浩劫之後出現反彈。

sentences.english: Dual lead worm system would be very easy to adjust backlash.
sentences.chinese: 雙系統會導致蠕蟲病毒很容易調整反彈。

sentences.english: No sooner did it release its trial balloon on the Luxury Tax, than it met with a public backlash.
sentences.chinese: 課徵奢侈稅才放出風向球，就因民意反彈而收手等等。

sentences.english: So, it should not be surprised to see an oversold relief bounce in the coming days.
sentences.chinese: 因此未來數日標普出現超跌反彈行情是不足爲奇的。

definition: to undulate/to fluctuate/wave motion/rise and fall
